Prior to Summit, Dayton ran the CTPartners practice serving venture capital and growth equity clients and their portfolio companies across executive, board and partner/principal investor searches. Previously, he was a cofounder of full-service technology recruiting boutique Fortis Partners and a senior associate at Spencer Stuart. Before that, he was one of the first salespeople at SoBe, a start-up in the nutraceutical beverage category that was acquired by Pepsi. Dayton holds a BA in American Studies, with highest distinction, from Wittenberg University. Dayton is actively involved in the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF), the leading global organization funding type 1 diabetes (T1D) research. He currently serves on the corporate development board of JDRF New England.

Name: Nik Ohri
Title: Vice President
Bio: Nik first joined Summit in 2017. Today, as a Vice President, he focuses primarily on the technology sector in Europe.  Nik’s board and investment experience includes Akeneo, Cenosco, Odoo, OneStock SAS, Red Points, Revizto and TradingHub. Prior to Summit, Nik worked as an Investment Banking Analyst in the Leveraged Finance Group at Goldman Sachs. He holds a BS, with first class honors, in economics from the London School of Economics and Political Science and an MBA from Harvard Business School. Nik is a co-founder and advisory board member at Kickstart Global, a non-profit organization focused on educating and mentoring student entrepreneurs.

Name: Aramide Olaniyan
Title: Vice President
Bio: Aramide focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. His investment experience includes RIS Rx. Previously, Aramide worked at Davita and in the Jefferies Health Care Investment Banking Group, where he focused on M&A transactions as well as public and private offerings. He holds a BA in political science from the University of California, Los Angeles, and an MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business. Aramide is a three-year letterman and former Division I linebacker at the University of California, Los Angeles. During his time at UCLA, he received the Jackie R. Robinson Award for the highest academic achievement by a senior and was named to the 2013 Pac-12 All-Academic Second Team. He was also awarded the Pac-12 Post-Graduate Scholarship. Aramide remains actively involved in mentoring student-athletes on the UCLA football team. He is also an SEO alumnus and mentor.

Name: Nick Oppedisano
Title: Partner
Bio: Nick joined Summit Partners in 2019 and focuses primarily on the technology sector. His investment and board experience includes CoderPad, Foxen, Furnished Finder, Jobber, PriceLabs and Recharge. Prior to joining Summit, Nick spent nine years helping companies create value through mergers and acquisitions, working on Centerview Partners’ tech investment banking team in Palo Alto and on Goldman Sachs’ tech, media, telecom investment banking team in San Francisco. Nicks holds degrees in business administration from Ivey Business School and engineering from the University of Western Ontario.

Name: Jono Pagden
Title: Principal
Bio: Jono focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector in Europe. His investment experience includes Advance Medical (acquired by Teladoc), CluePoints, Fortis Life Sciences and zahneins (acquired by PAI Partners). Prior to Summit, Jono worked on the Retail/Healthcare and U.K. M&A teams at Goldman Sachs. Jono holds a Bachelor of Business Science, with honors, in accounting and finance from the University of Cape Town. He is a dual British and South African national.

Name: Matthias G. Allgaier
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Matthias joined Summit Partners in 2015 and focuses primarily on the technology sector in Europe. His current board and investment experience includes Elatec, FNZ and Lingoda. Matthias' previous board and investment experience includes Appway (acquired by FNZ), Market Logic, ProGlove (acquired by Nordic Capital), Signavio (acquired by SAP) and zahneins (acquired by PAI Partners). Prior to Summit, Matthias was a Managing Director with H.I.G. Capital Europe, where he focused on investments in the technology and business services sectors. While at H.I.G., his directorships included: FNZ Ltd, Duales System Deutschland, Fibercore Ltd, AR Metalizing, International Schools of Europe, The Engine Group and VNU Media. Matthias began his career with Apax Partners and General Atlantic Partners. Matthias holds an MBA from Mannheim University and a Doctorate in Business Administration from Karl Franzens University. He is a German national and speaks German and English.

Name: David W. Averett
Title: Managing Director, Peak Performance Group
Bio: Dave joined Summit Partners in 2010. As the head of Summit’s Peak Performance Group (PPG), Dave works with management teams to identify and execute growth strategies that build long-term value. He oversees day-to-day management of PPG engagements across all geographies. Prior to Summit, Dave held operational and strategic leadership roles at a variety of companies, including Immco Diagnostics (acquired by Trinity Biotech in 2013) and George Group (acquired by Accenture in 2007). He holds a BS in mathematical sciences from the U.S. Military Academy at West Point and an MBA from Goizueta Business School, Emory University. Dave has partnered with numerous portfolio companies on growth acceleration initiatives. Representative engagements include: Sales force expansion and optimization for online payment services company Manufacturing and supply chain improvement for a radio frequency semiconductors and components company Supply chain optimization for a broadband wireless network provider New product evaluation and introduction to drive same-store sales growth for a network of hospitals Dave has been a competitive rugby player for more than 20 years and has served in a variety of leadership roles within the governance structure of these 501(c)(3) organizations. His experience includes helping teams raise and manage funds and coordinate volunteer efforts to give back to the communities where they reside.

Name: Joe Balaban
Title: Associate
Bio: Joe focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Prior to Summit, Joe worked in the Healthcare Investment Banking group at Jefferies. Previously, he worked in the Healthcare M&A group at Duff & Phelps. He holds a BA in history, with honors, from Dartmouth College.

Name: Darren M. Black
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Darren joined Summit Partners in 2013 and focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. His current board directorships include Earned Wealth, Fortis Life Sciences, InnovaCare Partners, Leon Medical Centers, LifeStance Health (NASDAQ: LFST), Paradigm Outcomes, RIS Rx, Sound Physicians, TurningPoint Healthcare Solutions, US Health Partners, U.S. Renal Care, VaxCare and Veranex. Darren's previous board and investment experience includes Abode Healthcare (acquired by BrightSpring Health Services), ABILITY Network (acquired by Inovalon), Advance Health (acquired by New Mountain Capital), DMG Practice Management Solutions (acquired by Ares Management), HealthSun (acquired by Anthem) and PharmScript (Acquired by OptumRx). Prior to Summit, Darren was a Managing Partner with SV Life Sciences, where he focused on healthcare services, healthcare information technology and pharmaceutical services. Prior to SV Life Sciences, Darren was Cofounder and President of two companies—ClinCare and PharmaStar. Previously, he was a healthcare consultant for Accenture. Darren holds an AB in government from Harvard College and an MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. He serves on the board of directors for Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center and Combined Jewish Philanthropies.

Name: Chris Bon
Title: Principal
Bio: Chris is a Principal on the Growth Products & Services team in Europe. His board and investment experience includes CERTANIA, Doctrine, Energy Aspects, GRESB, Normec (acquired by Astorg), One Point Advisory Services, OnRobot, ProGlove (acquired by Nordic Capital), Simply.TV and Sipartech (acquired by Blackstone). Prior to Summit, Chris worked in M&A advisory at J.P. Morgan. He holds a BCom in economics, with high honors, from the University of Toronto and an MSc in finance, with distinction, from HEC Paris. Chris is a dual French and British citizen, and is bilingual in French and English.

Name: Kurt A. Brimberry
Title: Principal, Infrastructure Technology
Bio: Kurt Brimberry is member of Summit Partners’ Peak Performance Group and works with portfolio company management teams to help identify and execute growth strategies that build long-term value. Most frequently, he collaborates with portfolio companies to help expand and achieve greater ROI from digital transformation initiatives. Prior to Summit, Kurt worked for the Harvey Performance Company where he implemented a number of enterprise technology systems and held a variety of sales and business analytics roles. Previously, he worked as a financial data specialist for ByAllAccounts, a financial data consolidation platform. Kurt holds a BA in managerial economics from Union College.

Name: Steven M. Cardillo
Title: Director, Portfolio M&A
Bio: Steve is a member of Summit’s Peak Performance Group and works with management teams to help identify and execute growth strategies that build long-term value. Most frequently, he works with portfolio company leadership teams to support effective M&A initiatives within their organizations, spanning strategy, execution and integration. Most recently, Steve was Vice President of Corporate Development at Continuum, a Summit portfolio company that provides a SaaS-based security management platform for IT service providers. Steve began his career as an Associate at Summit Partners, where he was actively involved in the firm’s investments in Continuum (acquired by Thoma Bravo; subsequently acquired by ConnectWise) and FleetCor Technologies (NYSE: FLT). As a member of Continuum’s management team, Steve was responsible for the company’s M&A, partnership and data analytics functions. He also served as General Manager of BrightGauge Software following Continuum’s acquisition of the business. Steve holds a BS in management, summa cum laude, from Boston College.

Name: Chase Carpenter
Title: Senior Associate, Growth Marketing
Bio: Chase is a member of Summit’s Peak Performance Group and works with management teams across the B2B portfolio to help identify and execute growth strategies that build long-term value. Most frequently, he collaborates to help drive the effectiveness and efficiency of marketing initiatives. Prior to Summit, Chase was Chief Digital Officer at CommCreative, where he led the agency’s digital marketing team in the service of clients in SaaS, logistics, manufacturing, healthcare, and cybersecurity. Previously, he worked at Deloitte Digital within the firm’s Salesforce Marketing Cloud practice. Chase holds an AB in comparative literature with a French citation, magna cum laude, from Harvard University. Chase also serves as an active board member and volunteer for Jewish Family Service of Metrowest, a Massachusetts-based non-profit providing social services for communities, families, and individuals of all ages, faiths, and backgrounds.

Name: Billy Carrabino
Title: Associate
Bio: Billy focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. His current investment experience includes Hallmark Health Care Solutions. Prior to Summit, Billy worked for Great Point Partners. Billy holds a BS in business management, magna cum laude, from the D’Amore-McKim School of Business at Northeastern University.

Name: John R. Carroll
Title: Managing Director
Bio: John first joined Summit Partners in 1993 as an Associate. Today, as a Managing Director, he focuses primarily on business services and tech-enabled services opportunities and is currently a board director of 48forty Solutions, CollisionRight, OTR Solutions, Patriot Growth Insurance Services and Snap Finance. John's prior investments and directorships include Associa, Blue Ocean Software (acquired by Intuit), Clinical Pathology Laboratories (acquired by Sonic Healthcare), Continuum (acquired by Thoma Bravo), FineLine Technologies (acquired by L Squared Capital Partners), FleetCor Technologies (NYSE: FLT), Fortegra Financial (NYSE: FRF, later acquired by Tiptree Financial), Harvey Performance Company (acquired by Berkshire Partners), HelpSystems (acquired by H.I.G. Capital), Innov-X Systems (acquired by Olympus Corporation), Masternaut, Solid State Equipment (acquired by Veeco Instruments), Sybari Software (acquired by Microsoft) and Systems Maintenance Services (acquired by Partners Group). Prior to Summit, John worked at BayBank. While attending business school, John worked for Bain & Company before rejoining Summit in 1998. John holds an AB in economics, cum laude, from Dartmouth College and an MBA, with distinction, from the Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University.

Name: Mike Chen
Title: Principal
Bio: Mike focuses primarily on the technology sector. Prior to Summit, Mike served as a Director at Elliott Management where he played an active role building the firm’s technology private equity strategy. Previously, he held roles at BC Partners and J.P. Morgan. Mike holds a BS in economics, summa cum laude, from the Wharton School and a BA in anthropology from the College of Arts and Sciences at the University of Pennsylvania. ‍

Name: Hanyin Cheng
Title: Principal
Bio: Hanyin joined Summit Partners in 2014 and focuses primarily on the technology sector. His investment experience includes Fuze (acquired by 8x8), HyperLight, Keeper Security, QAD, Redzone (acquired by QAD), StackAdapt and Vensure Employer Services (formerly PrismHR). Previously, Hanyin worked on the Technology, Media and Telecommunications Group at UBS Investment Bank. Hanyin holds a BA in computer science and economics from Boston College and an MBA from Harvard Business School. He is fluent in English and Mandarin.

Name: Peter Y. Chung
Title: Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer
Bio: Peter joined Summit Partners in 1994 and focuses primarily on the technology sector. He has invested in more than 30 companies including 18 currently or formerly publicly-traded companies. Peter has served as the Firm’s Chief Executive Officer since 2015. Peter is currently a director of Empower RF Systems, HyperLight, Sound Physicians, Striim and Syndigo. Peter's previous board and investment experience includes E-TEK Dynamics (NASDAQ: ETEK, later merged with JDS Uniphase in a transaction valued at over $18 billion), A10 Networks (NYSE: ATEN), Acacia Communications (NASDAQ: ACIA, later acquired by Cisco), AltoCom (acquired by Broadcom), Card Capture Services (acquired by E*Trade), Ditech Networks (NASDAQ: DITC, later acquired by Nuance Communications), Finisar (NASDAQ: FNSR, later acquired by Coherent), GoldenGate Software (acquired by Oracle Corporation), MACOM (NASDAQ: MTSI), NightHawk Radiology (NASDAQ: NHWK, later acquired by Virtual Radiologic), Parts Town, SeaBright Insurance (NYSE: SBX, later acquired by Enstar Group Limited), Sirenza Microdevices (NASDAQ: SMDI, later acquired by RF Micro Devices) and Splash Technology (NASDAQ: SPLH, later acquired by Electronics for Imaging). Prior to Summit, Peter worked in the Mergers & Acquisitions department of Goldman, Sachs & Co. He holds an AB in economics, magna cum laude, from Harvard University and an MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business. Peter has been named to the Forbes Midas List multiple times and is an Emeritus Trustee of the California Academy of Sciences. He currently serves on the Executive Board of the Friends of Harvard Football, the Executive Committee of the Harvard College Fund and the Board of Directors of the National Park Foundation. Peter previously served as a trustee of the Stanford Graduate School of Business Trust, a board member of the National Venture Capital Association, a director of the Asian Pacific Fund, and a member of the Advisory Board of the Salvation Army’s Golden State Division.

Name: Antony C. Clavel
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Antony joined Summit Partners in 2013, and focuses primarily on the technology sector in Europe, with an emphasis on software. His current investment and board experience includesImmersive Labs, LearnUpon, Odoo, Revizto, Syncron and TradingHub. Antony's prior experience includes Calypso Technology (acquired by Thoma Bravo), Darktrace (IPO, later acquired by Thoma Bravo), RELEX Solutions (acquired by Blackstone Growth and TCV) and Siteimprove (acquired by Nordic Capital). Prior to Summit, Antony worked for Allen & Company where he advised US and European technology entrepreneurs on M&A and raising capital. He was also active in the firm’s investments.Antony holds a BA in mathematics from Oxford University with first class honors and an SM in computer science from Harvard University. He is a Swiss national and speaks English and Italian.

Name: Scott C. Collins
Title: Managing Director and Chief Operating Officer
Bio: Scott joined Summit Partners in 1996 and is focused primarily on the technology sector. He founded the firm's London office in 2001, which he managed through 2016. Scott has made investments in—and served as a board director for—more than 30 companies. Currently he is a director of Invicti Security and Veepee. Scott's prior directorships include 360T Group (acquired by Deutsche Börse), Acturis Limited (acquired by Astorg), Avast (LON: AVST), Calypso Technology (acquired by Thoma Bravo), DentalPro (acquired by BC Partners), Hittite Microwave Corporation (NASDAQ: HITT, later acquired by Analog Devices), Jamba! AG (acquired by VeriSign), Multifonds (acquired by Temenos), Ogone (acquired by Ingenico), PrismHR (acquired by Vensure Employer Services), SafeBoot (acquired by McAfee), Signavio (acquired by SAP), Web Reservations International (acquired by Hellman & Friedman), Welltec International (acquired by Exor and 7 Industries) and Westwing Group (FRA: WEW). Prior to Summit Partners, Scott worked as a strategy consultant with McKinsey & Company in the financial institutions group. He also served in a variety of U.S. federal government positions, including at the White House and Department of Justice. Scott holds an AB in economics, magna cum laude, from Harvard University and a JD, cum laude, from Harvard Law School. While at Harvard, he was Phi Beta Kappa, Captain of the Varsity Football Team and later served as Managing Editor of the Harvard Law Review. Scott is a former Elected Director of the Harvard Alumni Association and currently serves on the University’s Joint Committee on Alumni Affairs and Development, the Dean’s Council at Harvard Law School and as a Director of the Harvard Varsity Club. Scott was a Founding Trustee of the Private Equity Foundation, a leading venture philanthropy in the U.K. dedicated to improving the lives of underprivileged youth. He has served on the Board of Directors of City Year Boston and currently serves on the President’s Council of Massachusetts General Hospital. Scott holds dual citizenship in the United States and United Kingdom.

Name: Andrew J. Collins
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Andy joined Summit Partners in 2008, and focuses primarily on the technology sector, with an emphasis on software. His current investment and board experience includes Furnished Finder, Jamf (NASDAQ: JAMF), Jungle Scout, NinjaOne, Output, Podium Corporation, Recharge, Red Canary and Striim. Andy’s prior experience includes InfoArmor (acquired by Allstate Corporation), NetWitness (acquired by EMC Corporation), Reverb.com (acquired by Etsy), RiskIQ (acquired by Microsoft), Uber (NYSE: UBER), Ubiquiti (NYSE: UI, formerly Ubiquiti Networks), Wildfire Interactive (acquired by Google) and Winshuttle (acquired by Symphony Technology Group). Prior to Summit, Andy worked as an investment banking analyst in the Mergers and Acquisitions group at Bank of America Securities. Before that, he worked for ABN Amro Financial Services in Chicago. Andy holds a BS in finance from Miami University.

Name: Christopher J. Dean
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Chris joined Summit Partners in 2001 and co-leads the Growth Products & Services team. He has served as a board director for many companies and is currently a director of a.k.a. Brands (NYSE: AKA), Brooklinen, Celcoin, Dr. Squatch, Quay Australia, ShipMonk and Vestmark Financial. Chris' prior directorships include Champion Windows (acquired by Great Day Improvements), EngageSmart (NYSE: ESMT), Focus Financial Partners (NYSE: FOCS), Investor Management Services (acquired by RealPage, NASDAQ: RP), optionsXpress (NASDAQ: OXPS, acquired by Charles Schwab, NYSE: SCHW), Progressive Finance (acquired by Aaron's, NYSE: AAN), PSC Info Group (acquired by Roark Capital), Salient Partners, Senior Home Care (acquired by Oaktree Capital) and Sun Trading (acquired by Hudson Trading). Prior to Summit, Chris worked for Morgan Stanley, J.H. Whitney & Co. and Sun Microsystems. He holds a BA in history, summa cum laude, from the University of Notre Dame and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Name: Meg Riley Devine
Title: Chief Marketing Officer
Bio: Meg joined Summit Partners in 2015, and leads the firm's marketing and communications programs. Prior to Summit, she was a Principal at North Bridge on the firm’s growth equity team. Previously, she held positions at Advent International and State Street Research & Management. Meg received a BA in economics and French, magna cum laude, from Amherst College and an MBA from Stanford University. In addition, she is a CFA charterholder.

Name: Josh Diamond
Title: Associate
Bio: Josh focuses primarily on the technology sector. Prior to Summit, Josh worked in the Investment Banking Group at Barclays. Previously, he worked in the Mergers and Acquisitions group at National Bank Financial. He holds an Masters in finance, as well as a BS in pharmacology, from McGill University.

Name: Ali Dowd
Title: Principal
Bio: Ali focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Her investment experience includes Veranex. Prior to Summit, Ali worked in the Healthcare Group at Thomas H. Lee Partners. Previously, she worked at TA Associates and BlackArch Partners. Ali holds a BA in economics, cum laude, from Vanderbilt University.

Name: Aditi K. Erdman
Title: Senior Associate
Bio: Aditi focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Her investment and board experience includes Hallmark Health Care Solutions and LumaBridge. Prior to Summit, Aditi worked in the Healthcare Investment Banking group at Wells Fargo Securities, where she covered companies across the life sciences industry. Aditi holds a BA in chemistry and French, with distinction, from Amherst College.

Name: Wesley Fales
Title: Associate, Capital Markets
Bio: Wesley is a member of Summit’s Capital Markets team, where he works on the firm’s capital markets activities, both for existing portfolio companies and for new acquisitions. In addition, he helps Summit manage its commercial and investment banking relationships. Prior to Summit, Wesley worked in the Healthcare Investment Banking Group at Mizuho Securities. Wesley holds a BS in business administration with a concentration in finance, summa cum laude, from Fordham University, Gabelli School of Business.

Name: Luke T. Farrugia
Title: Senior Associate
Bio: Luke focuses primarily on the technology sector in Europe. His investment experience includes ImagenAI. Prior to Summit, Luke worked at Macquarie Capital, working across both M&A and growth capital with a focus on the technology sector. Luke holds a BSc, with first class honors, in mathematics and economics from the University of Warwick.

Name: Greta Felten
Title: Associate
Bio: Greta is an Associate on the Growth Products & Services team. Prior to Summit, Greta worked in the Industrials Investment Banking Group at Moelis & Company. Previously, she co-founded and served as CEO of Empressed, a startup selling fashionable, feminine, women’s corporate swag. Greta holds a BBA in finance with a specialization in alternative asset management from SMU’s Cox School of Business. ‍

Name: Scott R. Ferguson
Title: Partner
Bio: Scott joined Summit Partners in 2009 and focuses primarily on the technology sector. His investment and board experience includes Calypso Technology (acquired by Thoma Bravo), HelpSystems (acquired by H.I.G. Capital), MercuryGate, Perforce Software (acquired by Clearlake Capital), Teaching Strategies (acquired by KKR) and Trintech. Prior to Summit, Scott worked in the Technology Investment Banking Group at Piper Jaffray. He holds a BS in finance from the University of Kansas and an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University, where he was an F.C. Austin Scholar.

Name: Leonard C. Ferrington
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Len joined Summit Partners in 2006. As a Managing Director, he leads investments across the technology sector. His key areas of emphasis include robotics and automation, application software, and solutions enhancing education, talent and overall workforce productivity. Len's current board and investment experience includes Keeper Security, Ruffalo Noel Levitz, StackAdapt and Ylopo. His prior experience includes A10 Networks (NYSE: ATEN), Access Information Management (acquired by Berkshire Partners), Aeryon Labs (acquired by FLIR Systems), Ascentis (acquired by UKG), Heald College (acquired by Corinthian Colleges), Redzone (acquired by QAD), Smartsheet (acquired by Blackstone and Vista Equity Partners 2025), Teaching Strategies (acquired by KKR), Trident University International (acquired by Perdoceo Education Corporation) and Ubiquiti (NYSE: UI, formerly Ubiquiti Networks). Prior to Summit, Len worked for venture capital firm Celerity Partners and Baxter Healthcare International. He received a BS in accounting from the Leventhal School of Accounting at the University of Southern California.

Name: Craig D. Frances, M.D.
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Craig joined Summit Partners in 2003 and focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. His board directorships and investment experience includes BluePearl Veterinary Services (acquired by Mars Petcare),HealthCare Partners (merged with DaVita, NYSE: DVA), Healthline Media (acquired by Red Ventures), Integrated DNA Technologies (acquired by Danaher), Independent Vetcare (acquired by EQT), MedSpring Urgent Care (acquired by Fresenius Medical Care), National Veterinary Associates (acquired by Ares Management), Physicians Formula (NASDAQ: FACE) and Solutionreach. Prior to Summit, Craig was founder and manager of three successful companies. He was also the Chief Medical Resident at the University of California, San Francisco. Craig holds a BA in psychology, with honors, from Cornell University and an MD from Cornell University Medical College, where he was valedictorian and received the Paul Sherlock Prize, a peer-voted award for exceptional integrity and compassion in patient care. He is the creator of the Saint-Frances Series, medical books that are used extensively in academic centers across the United States. Craig has numerous publications in leading journals, including the New England Journal of Medicine , and has collaborated with many national healthcare leaders. He serves as an advisor to the Cornell University Trustees Investment Committee regarding private equity, and he is a former President of the Healthcare Private Equity Association (HCPEA). Craig has been named one of the 40 Smartest People in Healthcare by Becker’s Hospital Review .

Name: Peter A. Francis
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Peter focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector, with an emphasis on healthcare providers, healthcare services and healthcare technology. His investment and board experience includes Blended Health, BluePearl Veterinary Services (acquired by Mars Petcare), Healthline Media (acquired by Red Ventures), HealthSun (acquired by Anthem), InnovaCare Health, Leon Medical Centers, Medical Review Institute of America and Solutionreach. Prior to Summit, Peter worked for Jefferies & Company and UBS Investment Bank in the global healthcare team, focused on U.S. and Asian healthcare services and real estate. Peter holds a BA in economics from Cornell University.

Name: Jerome Fulton, Jr.
Title: Senior Associate
Bio: Jerome focuses primarily on the technology sector. Prior to Summit, Jerome worked in the Finance Strategy Group at Deloitte Consulting. Previously, he worked at Ernst and Young. Jerome holds a BS in accounting from the University of Florida, a MAcc from the University of Southern California, and an MBA with distinction from Harvard Business School where he was a RISE Fellow and a PREA Scholar. He is also a CPA. Jerome volunteers with Management Leadership for Tomorrow, where he mentors underrepresented professionals who aspire to obtain an MBA.

Name: Paul G. Furer
Title: Partner
Bio: Paul first joined Summit Partners as an Associate in 2011. Today, he is a Partner on the Growth Products & Services team. His current board and investment experience includes 48forty Solutions, a.k.a. Brands (NYSE: AKA), Beyond Risk, Patriot Growth Insurance Services and UHY. Paul’s prior investments and directorships include FineLine Technologies (acquired by L Squared Capital Partners and Leonard Green Partners), Harvey Performance Company (acquired by Berkshire Partners), Parts Town (acquired by Berkshire Partners and Leonard Green Partners) and Vivint Smart Home (NYSE: VVNT). Prior to Summit, Paul worked for Jefferies and Bank of America Merrill Lynch in their mergers and acquisitions groups. He holds a BS in finance from Indiana University’s Kelley School of Business and an MBA from Columbia Business School.

Name: Sebastian Gaab
Title: Associate
Bio: Sebastian is an Associate on the Growth Products & Services team. He is a German national and speaks German and English. His investment experience includes Simply.TV. Prior to Summit, Sebastian worked as an Investment Banking Analyst on the EMEA M&A Execution team at Morgan Stanley. Sebastian holds a BSc in economics, with First Class honours, from The London School of Economics and Political Science.

Name: Karrisha M. Gillespie
Title: Associate
Bio: Karrisha is an Associate on the Growth Products & Services team. Prior to Summit, Karrisha worked in the Diversified Industries Investment Banking group at J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. She holds a BA in Political Science and Economics from Wellesley College. Karrisha also serves on the board and chairs the Fundraising Committee for Synergist, a national network of women investors focused on providing the infrastructure, network and business acumen critical for long-term success.

Name: Jonathan H. Gilman
Title: Vice President
Bio: Jonathan focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. His investment experience includes Abode Healthcare (acquired by BrightSpring Health Services), Fortis Life Sciences, Hallmark Health Care Solutions, InnovaCare Health, Leon Medical Centers, TurningPoint Healthcare Solutions and U.S. Renal Care. Prior to Summit, Jonathan worked in the Global Healthcare Group in the Investment Banking Division at Jefferies. Previously, he worked as an Investment Banking Analyst in the Financial Institutions Group at Nomura. Jonathan holds a BS in finance and economics from New York University’s Stern School of Business.

Name: Sydney Glickson
Title: Analyst
Bio: Sydney focuses primarily on the technology sector. Her investment experience includes HyperLight. Prior to Summit, Sydney served as a founding partner at Ascend Speech and Debate Communications. Sydney holds a BA in German, summa cum laude, with a minor in psychology, from Wake Forest University, where she was a Stamps Scholar. In addition, Sydney is a registered yoga instructor.

Name: Ricardo Gonzalez
Title: Partner
Bio: Ricardo is a Partner on the Growth Products & Services team. Prior to Summit, Ricardo was a Managing Director at New Mountain Capital. Previously, he was a Director at Hellman & Friedman. Earlier in his career, he held roles at the Boston Consulting Group and Eli Lilly and Company. Ricardo holds a BS in physics, summa cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa, from the City College of New York, an MS in biological engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, where he was a PD Soros fellow, and an MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business. ‍

Name: Robert E. Grady
Title: Advisory Partner
Bio: As an Advisory Partner, Bob works closely with Summit’s investment teams, particularly in the Growth Products & Services and Technology areas, to identify new investment opportunities and collaborate with portfolio company leaders to help shape growth strategies focused on long-term value creation. Bob also assists in the firm’s business development activities. Bob currently serves on the board of directors at CollisionRight and OTR Solutions. Bob brings over 30 years of investment experience. His investments and board seats have included Align Technology (Nasdaq: “ALGN”), Authentec (Nasdaq: “AUTH”, acquired by Apple), Blackboard (Nasdaq: “BBBB”, acquired by Providence Equity), eScreen (acquired by Alere/Abbott Labs), Maxim Integrated Products (Nasdaq: “MXIM”, acquired by Analog Devices), Pacur, Potter Global (acquired by KKR), Thomas Weisel Partners (Nasdaq: “TWPG”, acquired by Stifel Financial), Transportation Insight, Viator (acquired by Trip Advisor), Wall Street Institute (acquired by Pearson), and Washing Systems (acquired by Kao Corporation). Immediately prior to joining Summit, Bob was a Partner at Gryphon Investors, where he served as Head of the Industrial Growth Group and oversaw both Business Development and the creation of the firm’s software practice. Previously, Bob was a Partner at Cheyenne Capital Fund, a private equity fund-of-funds and co-investment fund, and Chairman of the Board and Chairman of the Investment Policy Committee for the New Jersey State Investment Council, which oversees the state’s $78 billion pension fund. Bob served for a decade as a Partner and member of the Management Committee at The Carlyle Group, where he was the Global Head of Venture & Growth Capital. While at Carlyle, Bob served as Chairman of the National Venture Capital Association (NVCA). Bob began his finance career at Robertson, Stephens & Co., where he was a Partner and served as a member of the firm’s Management Committee. Earlier in his career, Bob worked in the White House as a senior policy advisor to President George H.W. Bush. He held several key roles, including Deputy Assistant to the President, Executive Associate Director of the Office of Management & Budget (OMB), OMB Associate Director for Natural Resources, Energy and Science, and chief speechwriter on the successful 1988 Bush-Quayle presidential campaign. He began his career as Legislative and then Administrative Assistant to U.S. Congresswoman Millicent Fenwick and as Director of Communications and Policy for New Jersey Governor Thomas H. Kean. Bob holds an AB, cum laude, from Harvard College and an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business, where he taught for over a decade as a Lecturer in Public Management. Bob has served as a director of more than two dozen private and public companies. In addition to the Summit board and investment experience listed above, Bob is currently a member of the Board of Directors at Stifel Financial (NYSE: SF), the Board of Overseers of the Hoover Institution at Stanford University, and the Board of Trustees of Proctor Academy.  He is also a member of the Council on Foreign Relations.

Name: Johannes N. Grefe
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Johannes joined Summit Partners in 2012, and is a Managing Director on the Growth Products & Services team in Europe. His current board and investment experience includes CERTANIA, Cinerius Financial Partners, Doctrine, Energy Aspects, GRESB, One Point Advisory Services, OnRobot, Simply.TV and Solactive. His previous investments and directorships include Normec (acquired by Astorg), Peak Well Systems (acquired by Schlumberger), ProGlove (acquired by Nordic Capital), RadioOnkologieNetzwerk (acquired by Medipass), Sézane (acquired by General Atlantic), Sipartech (acquired by Blackstone), and zahneins (acquired by PAI Partners). Prior to Summit, Johannes worked for Vitruvian Partners, TA Associates and Lazard. Johannes holds an MSc in industrial engineering from University of Karlsruhe in Germany with highest distinction and an MS in engineering management from Portland State University. He is a German national and speaks English, German and Spanish.

Name: Grace C. Gwozdz
Title: Senior Associate
Bio: Grace focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Her current investment experience includes Earned Wealth and RIS Rx. Prior to Summit, Grace was a member of the Financial Services Group at Warburg Pincus. Previously, she worked in the AIMS Private Equity Group at Goldman Sachs. Grace holds a BA in statistics with a secondary focus in global health and health policy, cum laude, from Harvard University and an MA in statistics from Harvard University.

Name: Matthew G. Hamilton
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Matt joined Summit Partners in 2005 and is a Managing Director on the Growth Products & Services team. His current directorships and investment experience includes a.k.a. Brands (NYSE: AKA), Beyond Risk, Halborn, Insurcomm, Patriot Growth Insurance Services, Quay Australia, RWA Wealth Partners (formerly Adviser Investments), Snap Finance and Vestmark. Matt’s prior directorships and investments include EngageSmart (IPO, later acquired by Vista Equity Partners), Flow Traders (Euronext: FLOW), Focus Financial Partners (acquired by KKR and Stone Point Capital), Progressive Finance (acquired by Aaron's), Salient Partners and Telerik (acquired by Progress Software). Prior to Summit, Matt worked for Senator Olympia Snowe in the United States Senate. He received a BA in economics, summa cum laude, from Colby College.

Name: Sienna Henderson
Title: Analyst
Bio: Sienna is an Analyst on the Growth Products & Services team. Her investment experience includes UHY. Sienna holds a BA, summa cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa, in political science from Dartmouth College

Name: Adam H. Hennessey
Title: Managing Director and Chief Financial Officer
Bio: Adam joined Summit Partners in 2004. Prior to Summit, he worked for Oxford Bioscience Partners and PricewaterhouseCoopers. Adam received a BS in accounting and business planning & analysis from Babson College and an MBA from Northeastern University. He is also a CPA (expired).

Name: Mark F. Hexamer
Title: Principal, Growth Products & Services Human Capital
Bio: Mark works with Summit’s portfolio companies and investment teams to identify and recruit high-impact senior executives and board members. Prior to Summit, Mark was a founding member of CTGrowthPartners, a boutique within CTPartners serving venture capital and growth equity clients and their portfolio companies across executive, board and partner/principal investor searches. Previously, he was a partner at full-service technology recruiting firm Fortis Partners, a cofounder of the e-commerce website Swap.com and a cofounder of Sidebar Software, which focused on the legal market. Mark holds a BA in history from the University of Notre Dame and a JD/MBA from Boston College.

Name: Emma Himes
Title: Associate
Bio: Emma focuses primarily on the technology sector. Prior to Summit, Emma worked in the Global Technology Investment Banking Group at Morgan Stanley. Emma holds a BA in economics with a minor in international relations, business economics and American public policy from the University of Pennsylvania.

Name: Hunt Hobbs
Title: Associate
Bio: Hunt focuses primarily on the technology sector. His investment experience includes Instrumentl. Prior to Summit, Hunt worked in the mergers and acquisitions group at Bank of America. He holds a BA in politics, philosophy and economics (PPE) from Dartmouth College.

Name: Julianne Hummelberg
Title: Vice President
Bio: Julianne is a Vice President on the Growth Products & Services team. Her board and investment experience includes PostPilot. Prior to Summit, Julianne worked at PowerPlant Partners (now GroundForce Capital) where she led their growth equity investing team and served on the board of seven consumer companies including OWYN, REBBL and Chameleon Cold Brew. Previously, she worked at emerging growth equity firm Spring Mountain Capital, former Summit Portfolio Company Focus Financial Partners, Invesco Asset Management and Emerging Global Advisors (acquired by Ameriprise / Colombia Threadneedle). Julianne holds a BA, cum laude, in economics and global trade & commerce from Wake Forest University and an MBA, with a focus in private equity and venture capital, from Columbia Business School.

Name: Adesh S. Jain
Title: Principal
Bio: Adesh first joined Summit Partners in 2017 as an Associate. Today, he is a Principal on the Healthcare & Life Sciences team. His investment experience includes Blended Health, InnovaCare Health and Medical Review Institute of America. Prior to Summit, Adesh worked at MTS Health Partners. Adesh holds a BA in medicine, health and society, cum laude, from Vanderbilt University and an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business.

Name: Harry Jones
Title: Associate
Bio: Harry focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Prior to Summit, Harry worked in the Healthcare Investment Banking Group at Jefferies. Harry holds a BA in political science and international relations from Columbia University. He also served in the United States Marine Corps.

Name: Roy Kamineni
Title: Associate
Bio: Roy focuses primarily on the technology sector. His current investment experience includes Fundraise Up. Prior to Summit, Roy worked in the Media & Communications Investment Banking Group at Morgan Stanley. Roy holds a BS in business administration from the Walter A. Haas School of Business at the University of California Berkeley. He also holds a certificate in entrepreneurship & technology from the College of Engineering at the University of California Berkeley.

Name: Daniel J. Kim
Title: Associate
Bio: Daniel focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Prior to Summit, Daniel worked at Questa Capital Management, where he focused on healthcare services, health technology and medical technology. Previously, Daniel worked in the Global Healthcare Investment Banking Group at Credit Suisse. Daniel holds a dual BA, magna cum laude, in financial economics & international relations from SciencesPo Paris and Columbia University. He is also fluent in Korean and French.

Name: Daniel W. Kim
Title: Principal
Bio: Daniel focuses primarily on the technology sector. His current board and investment experience includes DocuSketch, Instrumentl and Netgain. Prior to Summit, Daniel worked on the Tech Growth team at KKR & Co. Prior to KKR, he worked at FTV Capital where he focused on the financial technology, payments and software sectors. Daniel began his career in technology investment banking at J.P. Morgan. Daniel holds a BA in statistics and BS in business administration from the University of California, Berkeley where he was a Regents’ and Chancellor’s Scholar.

Name: Lindsi M. Kimizuka
Title: Vice President, Product
Bio: Lindsi works closely with the Summit team and our portfolio companies to help bring best practices in product management and customer-focused design in support of growth strategy execution. Prior to Summit, Lindsi led product efforts at a variety of high-growth companies in the social gaming, e-commerce and fintech sectors. Lindsi holds a BS in English from the University of Wisconsin-Madison.

Name: Jan Klöppelt
Title: Senior Associate
Bio: Jan focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Prior to Summit, Jan worked as an Investment Banking Analyst in the EMEA Healthcare group at J.P. Morgan in London. Jan holds a BA in business administration and an MA in banking and finance from the University of St. Gallen. He is a German national and speaks German and English.

Name: Tim Kohn
Title: Technologist-in-Residence
Bio: As Technologist-in-Residence, Tim works closely with the Summit team and our portfolio companies to assist with product, engineering, organization design and architecture strategy. He brings over 25 years of experience in building high-scale software and web services for consumers and the enterprise. Tim began his career at Amazon, where he was one of the company's first 20 software developers. Over the years, he has played a pivotal role in Amazon’s rapid expansion, leading teams of over 1,000 people during critical phases of the company’s growth. Most recently, Tim served as Vice President of Video Experience Technology at Prime Video, where he had oversight of the Prime Video app across all platforms, commerce, content discovery, personalized recommendations, and content compliance. Before that, he held the position of Vice President of Networking at Amazon Web Services, where he managed all aspects of the Amazon network, including network designs, hardware and software development, operations, and network interconnection business development. Prior to his Vice President roles, Tim worked for Amazon.com, where he oversaw product classification, product data management and the development of algorithmic techniques for enhancing data quality. Tim is currently a guest lecturer focused on strategic innovation at London Business School and also serves as a Product and Technology mentor at the Centre for Climate Change Innovation in London. Tim holds a BA in international studies with a focus on Japan from the University of Washington.

Name: Lukas Krieg
Title: Associate
Bio: Lukas focuses primarily on the technology sector in Europe. His investment experience include Revizto. Prior to Summit, Lukas worked for Jefferies in their TMT Investment Banking team, primarily covering technology. Lukas holds a BSc in management & technology with a concentration on computer science from Technical University Munich and an MSc in finance from ESADE Business School. He is a German national and speaks German and English. ‍

Name: Alex LaPolice
Title: Vice President
Bio: Alex focuses primarily on the technology sector. His investment experience includes Keeper Security, Later (formerly Mavrck), StackAdapt and Ylopo. He holds a BA in economics from Harvard University.

Name: Andrew S. Lee
Title: Vice President
Bio: Andy is a Vice President on the Growth Products & Services team. His board and investment experience includes Beyond Risk, Insurcomm and Patriot Growth Insurance Services. Prior to Summit, Andy worked for Fisher Lynch Capital and Fidelity Investments. Andy holds a BA, cum laude, in psychology from Dartmouth College. He is fluent in English and Korean.

Name: Cody Lee
Title: Principal, Growth Marketing
Bio: Cody is a member of Summit’s Peak Performance Group and works with management teams across the full portfolio to help identify and execute growth strategies that build long-term value. Most frequently, he collaborates to help drive the effectiveness and efficiency of marketing initiatives. Prior to Summit, Cody was a partner at Lever & Dial, an investment and advisory firm dedicated to helping growth companies scale with world-class marketing. Previously, he was Head of Digital Marketing at an integrated creative agency and production company. In addition, Cody was a foundational member of the paid advertising team at Software Advice (acquired by Gartner), a premier software lead-generation firm and trusted resource for software buyers. Cody holds a BA, summa cum laude, in English and creative writing from The George Washington University. He began his early career as a copywriter for a healthcare ad agency.

Name: Yoon K. Lee
Title: Partner and Head of International Investor Relations
Bio: Yoon joined Summit in 2017 and supports the firm’s relationships with its Limited Partners in Europe, Middle East and Asia. Prior to Summit, Yoon served as a Senior Director at MVision Private Equity Advisers where she managed global fundraisings and developed and maintained investor relationships. Previously, she worked at Citigroup, where she worked within the Mergers & Acquisitions and Fixed Income divisions. Yoon holds an MSc in management from Hautes Etudes Commerciales (HEC) Paris and a BA in French literature and political science, magna cum laude, from Ewha Women’s University, Seoul. She is a UK national and speaks English, French and Korean.

Name: Nate Leskovec
Title: Analyst
Bio: Nate focuses primarily on the technology sector. He holds a BA in economics with a minor in psychology from Harvard University. While at Harvard, Nate played varsity football and served as the sole Captain for the 150th football team.

Name: Julia LeStrange Stern
Title: Director of Responsible Investing
Bio: Julia joined Summit Partners in 2023. As the director of Summit’s Responsible Investing (RI) program, Julia is responsible for the development and integration of our RI approach in the firm’s investment process and operations. Prior to Summit, Julia served as a Vice President at Thomas H. Lee Partners where she worked on compliance and ESG. Previously, she worked at Goldman Sachs both in the Merchant Banking Compliance and Financial Crime Compliance divisions. Prior to that, she worked at Booz Allen Hamilton in the Defense Intelligence practice. Julia holds a BA, magna cum laude, in international relations and Italian studies from Brown University and an MPP from the John F. Kennedy School of Government at Harvard University.

Name: Sharon Lin
Title: Vice President, Data Science
Bio: Sharon works closely with the Summit team and our portfolio companies to help create and execute strategies that effectively use data and analytics to drive better decisions and build better products. Prior to Summit, Sharon worked at WarnerMedia Discovery where she led an analytics and data science team for CNN Digital. Previously, she worked on and led data science and analytics teams at Twitch, Okta, and Upsight. Sharon holds a BA in statistics and economics, and an MS in data science from University of California, Berkeley. Sharon sponsors the Sharon X. Lin & Andrew R. Bullen Graduate Fellowship in Data Science at University of California, Berkeley. The award supports students in the Master of Information and Data Science program who show a commitment to gender equity.

Name: Ernest Ling
Title: Director of Revenue Optimization
Bio: Ernest is a member of Summit’s Peak Performance Group and works with management teams to identify and execute growth strategies that build long-term value. Most frequently, he collaborates with leadership teams to help expand and execute revenue growth and optimization strategies. Prior to Summit, Ernest led Global Sales Strategy at Splunk, a premier software company that provides AI-powered security and observability solutions. Previously, he served as the Director of GTM Strategy & Operations for Salesforce. Before joining Salesforce, Ernest served in the U.S. Army for more than five years as a Signal Corps Officer stationed in Korea. Ernest holds a BS in Computer Science from West Point and an MBA from UCLA’s Anderson School of Management.

Name: Emily Lynch
Title: Associate
Bio: Emily focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Prior to Summit, Emily worked in the Healthcare Investment Banking group at Jefferies. She holds a BS in applied economics and management from Cornell SC Johnson College of Business.

Name: Ravi A. Mahadevia
Title: Vice President
Bio: Ravi focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Prior to Summit, Ravi worked at Agilon Health, a healthcare technology and services company focused on advancing care delivery for vulnerable populations. Previously, he founded and served as CEO of Somnium Sleep Solutions, a provider of sleep diagnostic services to surgical hospitals and ambulatory surgical centers (ASCs). Ravi began his career in strategy & operations consulting at Deloitte and in investment banking at Lincoln International. Ravi holds a BS in psychology from Northwestern University and an MBA with a major in healthcare management from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

Name: John R. Martin
Title: Associate
Bio: John focuses primarily on the technology sector. Prior to Summit, John worked in the Technology Investment Banking Group at William Blair & Company. John holds a BBA in economics with a minor in mathematics, magna cum laude, from Villanova University.

Name: Ryan Aurelio McDonald
Title: Principal
Bio: Ryan focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. Prior to Summit, Ryan worked on the healthcare team at Norwest Venture Partners for over a decade. His previous investments include American Endovascular & Amputation Prevention, Blue Cloud Pediatric Surgery Centers (acquired by TPG), Crossover Health (acquired by Gurnet Point Capital), Elligo Health Research, iCardiac (acquired by ERT), Kyo (formerly Gateway Learning Group), Mindful Health Solutions, Onsite Dental and Scratch Financial (Scratchpay). In addition to his work in healthcare, Ryan spearheaded Norwest's investing efforts in Latin America. Previously, Ryan held roles in the Leveraged Finance Groups at Bank of America and Stifel Nicolaus. Earlier in his career, Ryan served as President and co-founder of a dietary supplement company. Ryan was raised in Mexico City and holds a BS in business management, with a concentration in economics, from Babson College.

Name: Patrick K. McLaughlin
Title: Senior Associate
Bio: Patrick is a Senior Associate on the Growth Products & Services Team. His investment experience includes CollisionRight and UHY. Prior to Summit, Patrick was a member of the investment teams at Abry Partners and Guidepost Growth Equity. He began his career in technology investment banking at Guggenheim Partners. Patrick holds a BA in political economy and English from Williams College.

Name: Michael A. Medici
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Michael joined Summit Partners in 2005 as an Associate. Today, as a Managing Director, he focuses primarily on the technology sector. Michael’s current board and investment experience includes Clarabridge, Fundraise Up, Klaviyo (NYSE: KVYO), Later (formerly Mavrck), MacStadium, Manychat, NetBrain Technologies, Sifted and Vestmark. Michael's prior investments and directorships include Acacia Communications (NASDAQ: ACIA, later acquired by Cisco), Accedian Networks (recapitalized by Bridge Growth Partners, later acquired by Cisco), Anesthetix (acquired by TeamHealth), Diagnostic Hybrids (acquired by Quidel Corporation), Fermentas International (acquired by Thermo Fisher Scientific), Hiperos (acquired by Opus Global), Logi Analytics (acquired by Marlin Equity Partners), Mi9 Retail (acquired by General Atlantic), Telerik (acquired by Progress Software) and Zenoss (acquired by Virtana). Prior to Summit, Michael worked for Prudential Capital Group. Michael received a BS in finance and international business from Georgetown University.

Name: Stephen Melia
Title: Vice President, Technology Human Capital
Bio: Stephen works with Summit’s portfolio companies and investment teams to help identify and recruit high-impact senior executives and board members, primarily in the technology sector. Prior to joining Summit, Stephen served as the Head of Talent for Vista Equity Partners’ Endeavor Fund, where he was responsible for building and maintaining the fund’s executive talent bench, as well as filling C-level positions within the portfolio. Previously, he was an Operating Partner at OpenView Venture Partners, where he focused on building out the firm’s people team function. Prior to OpenView, Stephen specialized in executing retained search for senior-level talent with roles at multinational firms True Search and Korn Ferry. Stephen holds a B.A. in economics from Union College. ‍ ‍

Name: Maria Mikhaylova
Title: Vice President
Bio: Maria focuses primarily on the technology sector. Prior to Summit, Maria worked at Vitruvian Partners where she focused on investing in growth companies within technology sector. Previously, she worked in the Technology, Media and Telecom (TMT) investment banking group at Goldman Sachs. Maria earned BS in mathematics and economics, with first-class honors, from the London School of Economics (LSE) and an MBA from Harvard Business School, where she was named a Baker Scholar. While at LSE, Maria was a member of the Women’s Rugby team and held a leadership role in the Ski Club.

Name: Max Miller
Title: Senior Associate, Investor Relations
Bio: Max is a member of Summit’s Investor Relations team and supports the firm’s relationships with its Limited Partners. He holds a BS in economics from Duke University.

Name: Colin T. Mistele
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Colin joined Summit Partners in 2011 as an Associate. Today, as a Managing Director, he focuses primarily on the technology sector. Colin’s current board directorships and investments include CoderPad, DocuSketch, Foxen, Instrumentl, Jamf (NASDAQ: JAMF), Jobber, Jungle Scout, NinjaOne, onX, Podium, PriceLabs, Red Canary and TextExpander. Colin's prior experience includes Advanced Cell Diagnostics (acquired by Bio-Techne Corporation), Delphix (acquired by Perforce Software), Gainsight (acquired by Vista Equity Partners), InfoArmor (acquired by Allstate Corporation), Reverb.com (acquired by Etsy), RiskIQ (acquired by Microsoft), TeleSign (acquired by BICS), Uber (NYSE: UBER) and Wowza Media Systems (acquired by Clearhaven Partners). Prior to Summit, Colin worked for Union Square Advisors, Accenture and Electronic Arts. He holds a BS in finance and marketing, with high honors, from Lehigh University.

Name: Irina Müller
Title: Vice President
Bio: Irina focuses primarily on the technology sector in Europe. Her investment experience includes Appway (acquired by FNZ), ProGlove (acquired by Nordic Capital), Solactive and TradingHub. Prior to Summit, Irina worked in the M&A Group at Houlihan Lokey. Irina holds a BA in business administration and an MA in banking and finance from the University of St. Gallen. She is a dual Swiss and U.S. citizen and speaks German and English.

Name: Sergio Mur
Title: Partner, Peak Performance Group
Bio: Sergio joined Summit Partners in 2016. As a member of Summit’s Peak Performance Group, he works with management teams across the Summit portfolio to help identify and execute growth strategies that build long-term value. Prior to Summit, Sergio worked as a Vice President of European Operations at Cerberus Capital. Before Cerberus, Sergio worked in business development at Privalia (acquired by vente-privee.com), planning and analysis at TJX Companies (NYSE: TJX) and Mergers and Acquisitions at J.P. Morgan. Sergio holds a CEMS Master in international management from St. Gallen University in Switzerland and a Master in business management from ESADE Business School in Spain. He is a Spanish national and speaks Spanish, German, French and English.

Name: Ross Murphy
Title: Director of Investor Relations
Bio: Ross joined Summit in 2020 and supports the firm’s relationships with its Limited Partners. Prior to Summit, Ross was Co-Head of Investor Relations at ArcLight Capital Partners, where he focused on capital raising efforts and managing investor, consultant and placement agent relationships. Previously, he was a Partner at MVision Equity Advisers, where he advised on and executed capital raises for U.S. and international private equity managers. Ross began his career at J.P. Morgan. Ross holds a BS in business administration from the Leeds School of Business at the University of Colorado.

Name: Patrick M. Murphy
Title: Principal
Bio: Patrick joined Summit Partners in 2016 and currently focuses on managing the firm's credit positions. Prior to Summit, Patrick worked as an Associate for the Private Credit Group at Proskauer Rose LLP, where he focused primarily on asset-based and cash-flow lending, first lien, second lien, subordinated and mezzanine financings, acquisition, recapitalization and other leveraged financings, cross-border financings and restructurings. Patrick holds a BA in environmental geology from Colgate University and a JD, with honors, from the University of Connecticut School of Law.

Name: Mark T. Nordstrom
Title: Partner, Capital Markets
Bio: Mark joined Summit Partners in 2010. He works on the firm’s capital markets activities, both for existing portfolio companies and for new acquisitions. In addition, he helps Summit manage its commercial and investment banking relationships. Prior to Summit, Mark worked for Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Merrill Lynch & Co. and State Street Corporation. Mark holds a BA in economics from Wesleyan University. In addition, Mark is a CFA charterholder.

Name: Luke Nowicki
Title: Vice President
Bio: Luke focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. His investment experience includes Club Champion and LakePharma (acquired by Curia). Prior to Summit, Luke worked as an M&A analyst in the TMT and Industrials groups at Harris Williams & Co. He holds a BBA in finance and mathematics, magna cum laude, from The College of William and Mary.

Name: Martin Nygaard
Title: Associate
Bio: Martin focuses primarily on the technology sector in Europe. His current investment experience includes Cenosco, MUBI and OneStock SAS. Prior to Summit, Martin worked for Lazard in the TMT Investment Banking Group. Previously, he played professional football in Norway and for the Norwegian national team. Martin holds a BS in business administration, summa cum laude, from Northeastern University with a concentration in finance and accounting. He is a Norwegian national and speaks Norwegian, English, Danish and Swedish.

Name: Devin O'Connor
Title: Director, Healthcare Human Capital
Bio: Devin works with Summit’s portfolio companies and investment teams to help drive executive talent management and human capital strategies across the healthcare and life sciences sector. Prior to Summit, Devin worked at Frazier Healthcare Partners where she led executive recruitment and network management for the firm and its portfolio companies. She supported a variety of human capital and ESG initiatives including pre-investment organizational assessment, post-investment organizational health management, and leadership recruitment and development. During her tenure at Frazier, Devin served as the Global Head of Strategic Initiatives and Change Management at Adare Pharma Solutions, a Frazier Healthcare Partners portfolio company. Previously, Devin worked in executive search and organizational design at Oxeon Partners. Devin holds a BA in psychology at Amherst College.

Name: Marie Obwaller
Title: Associate
Bio: Marie focuses primarily on the Healthcare & Life Sciences sector. Prior to Summit, Marie worked at Perella Weinberg Partners in the M&A Advisory Investment Banking team. Marie holds a B.Sc. in Business Management and Economics, with honors, from King’s College London and an M.Sc. in Management, with honors, from London Business School.

Name: Dayton R. Ogden
Title: Partner, Technology Human Capital
Bio: Dayton works with Summit’s portfolio companies and investment teams to identify and recruit high-impact senior executives and board members. Prior to Summit, Dayton ran the CTPartners practice serving venture capital and growth equity clients and their portfolio companies across executive, board and partner/principal investor searches. Previously, he was a cofounder of full-service technology recruiting boutique Fortis Partners and a senior associate at Spencer Stuart. Before that, he was one of the first salespeople at SoBe, a start-up in the nutraceutical beverage category that was acquired by Pepsi. Dayton holds a BA in American Studies, with highest distinction, from Wittenberg University. Dayton is actively involved in the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF), the leading global organization funding type 1 diabetes (T1D) research. He currently serves on the corporate development board of JDRF New England.

Name: Nik Ohri
Title: Vice President
Bio: Nik first joined Summit in 2017. Today, as a Vice President, he focuses primarily on the technology sector in Europe.  Nik’s board and investment experience includes Akeneo, Cenosco, Odoo, OneStock SAS, Red Points, Revizto and TradingHub. Prior to Summit, Nik worked as an Investment Banking Analyst in the Leveraged Finance Group at Goldman Sachs. He holds a BS, with first class honors, in economics from the London School of Economics and Political Science and an MBA from Harvard Business School. Nik is a co-founder and advisory board member at Kickstart Global, a non-profit organization focused on educating and mentoring student entrepreneurs.

Name: Aramide Olaniyan
Title: Vice President
Bio: Aramide focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. His investment experience includes RIS Rx. Previously, Aramide worked at Davita and in the Jefferies Health Care Investment Banking Group, where he focused on M&A transactions as well as public and private offerings. He holds a BA in political science from the University of California, Los Angeles, and an MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business. Aramide is a three-year letterman and former Division I linebacker at the University of California, Los Angeles. During his time at UCLA, he received the Jackie R. Robinson Award for the highest academic achievement by a senior and was named to the 2013 Pac-12 All-Academic Second Team. He was also awarded the Pac-12 Post-Graduate Scholarship. Aramide remains actively involved in mentoring student-athletes on the UCLA football team. He is also an SEO alumnus and mentor.

Name: Nick Oppedisano
Title: Partner
Bio: Nick joined Summit Partners in 2019 and focuses primarily on the technology sector. His investment and board experience includes CoderPad, Foxen, Furnished Finder, Jobber, PriceLabs and Recharge. Prior to joining Summit, Nick spent nine years helping companies create value through mergers and acquisitions, working on Centerview Partners’ tech investment banking team in Palo Alto and on Goldman Sachs’ tech, media, telecom investment banking team in San Francisco. Nicks holds degrees in business administration from Ivey Business School and engineering from the University of Western Ontario.

Name: Jono Pagden
Title: Principal
Bio: Jono focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector in Europe. His investment experience includes Advance Medical (acquired by Teladoc), CluePoints, Fortis Life Sciences and zahneins (acquired by PAI Partners). Prior to Summit, Jono worked on the Retail/Healthcare and U.K. M&A teams at Goldman Sachs. Jono holds a Bachelor of Business Science, with honors, in accounting and finance from the University of Cape Town. He is a dual British and South African national.

Name: Charlie Paradis
Title: Analyst
Bio: Charlie focuses primarily on the technology sector. Charlie holds an AB in psychology with a minor in economics from Harvard University.

Name: Luke Parsons
Title: Principal
Bio: Luke joined Summit in 2017 and focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector in Europe. His investment and board experience includes RadioOnkologieNetzwerk (acquired by Medipass) and Viroclinics Biosciences (acquired by Cerba Healthcare). Prior to Summit, Luke served as Vice President in the Mergers & Acquisitions division of Jefferies. Luke holds an MA in applied economics, with honors, from the University of St. Andrews.

Name: Steffan K. Peyer
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Steffan first joined Summit Partners as an Associate in 2007. Today, he focuses on the technology sector in  Europe. His current investment and board experience includes Akeneo, Elatec, ImagenAI, MUBI, Optimove, OneStock SAS and Red Points. Steffan's prior experience includes 360T Group (acquired by Deutsche Börse), Appway (acquired by FNZ), Market Logic, PatSnap, RELEX Solutions (acquired by Blackstone Growth and TCV) and Signavio (acquired by SAP). Prior to rejoining Summit in 2013, Steffan was a member of the management team of Turbulenz Limited. Before that, he worked for UBS Investment Bank. Steffan holds a BS in finance and accounting, magna cum laude, from Boston College. Steffan volunteered for Powerlungs in Switzerland, a not-for-profit focused on providing young asthmatic children with training courses in the sport of rowing. He is an American and Swiss national and speaks German and English.

Name: Sophia Popova
Title: Partner
Bio: Sophia joined Summit in 2017 and focuses primarily on the technology sector. Her current board and investment experience includes Invicti Security, Klaviyo (NYSE: KVYO), Later (formerly Mavrck), Manychat, Vensure Employer Services (formerly PrismHR), Sifted, StackAdapt and Ylopo. Prior to Summit, Sophia was an investment partner at Dorm Room Fund and held roles at several startups including Contactive, where she was Product Manager. Before that, Sophia worked for Morgan Stanley. Sophia holds a BA in economics and mathematics from Yale University and an MBA, with distinction, from Harvard Business School. She is fluent in English and Bulgarian.

Name: Alberto Reyes
Title: Senior Associate
Bio: Alberto is a Senior Associate on the Growth Products & Services team. His investment experience includes Celcoin and Halborn. Prior to Summit, Alberto worked in the Technology Investment Banking Group at Evercore. Previously, he worked at Bank of America in their M&A investment banking group. Alberto holds a BSBA in finance, summa cum laude, from the University of Arizona. In addition, Alberto is a former top-ranked tennis player in Mexico and a former Division 1 tennis player for the University of Oregon. He is an SEO alumnus and former mentor. He speaks English and Spanish.

Name: Neil Roseman
Title: Advisory Partner
Bio: As an Advisory Partner, Neil works closely with the Summit team and our portfolio companies to assist with engineering organization design and architecture strategy. He brings over 20 years of experience in building high-scale software and web services for consumers and the enterprise. Neil spent a decade at Amazon.com where he served as Vice President of Technology, responsible for Amazon.com’s Marketplace Platform, Digital Media Technologies, and World-wide Retail Software systems. He was instrumental in developing products, software and services for the Kindle line of e-readers, and he led many of Amazon’s most successful product launches, including Music and DVD stores, Marketplace, Amazon China and the initial Amazon Web Services product. Neil’s teams built and designed the Subscriptions Platform and Digital Ordering systems, which are still used globally by Amazon Prime, all Amazon Digital offerings and other Amazon.com services. After Amazon, Neil served as Vice President of Engineering for Zynga, where he created the company’s platform and led the launch of Zynga.com. Prior to Zynga, he founded Evri.com, which developed a new way for people to discover and engage with content on the web using a deep natural language approach. Earlier in his career, Neil worked for pioneering Internet music e-commerce startup Music Boulevard and BIOSIS (acquired by Thompson Reuters Scientific), a provider of indexing and search tools for the biology and life sciences communities. Neil holds a BA in biology from Temple University. In addition, he is an inventor on several patents in the e-commerce and semantic web domains. ‍ ‍ ‍ Advisory Partners are a group of persons employed and/or retained by Summit or any of its affiliates (and include both Summit and/or portfolio company employees and individuals not employed by Summit or any portfolio company) to provide certain functional and other services to Summit, the Summit funds and their portfolio companies. Advisory Partners are expected to receive expense reimbursements and compensation (including salary, retainer, fees, incentive equity, stock awards or other profits interests) from Summit, portfolio companies, prospective portfolio companies and/or directly from the fund, and are permitted to receive carried interest in one or more Summit funds. Such compensation will be in addition to, and will not result in offsets to or reductions of, the management fee paid to Summit by the fund. Advisory Partners are expected to work closely with Summit on various functional matters including, not limited to, business development activities, collaborate with investment teams to identify new investment opportunities, team with portfolio company leaders to help shape growth strategies focused on long-term value creation, or hold board seats at portfolio companies.

Name: Peter L. Rottier
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Peter joined Summit Partners in 2006, and focuses primarily on the technology sector. Peter's current board directorships and investments include MercuryGate, Syndigo and Trintech. Peter’s prior experience includes Answers (acquired by Apax Partners), Ascentis (acquired by UKG), Healthline Media (acquired by Red Ventures), HelpSystems (acquired by H.I.G. Capital), Infor (acquired by Golden Gate Capital and Koch Equity Development), ISH (acquired by PwC), Perforce Software (acquired by Clearlake Capital), Rocket Fuel (Nasdaq: FUEL), Salient Partners, Snap Fitness (acquired by TZP Capital Partners), Solid State Equipment (acquired by Veeco Instruments) and Systems Maintenance Services (acquired by Partners Group). Prior to Summit, Peter worked for KSL Capital Partners, Stone Arch Capital and RBC Capital Markets. Peter received a BS in finance from the Carlson School of Management at the University of Minnesota and an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business. He is a member of the Board of Overseers of the Carlson School of Management at the University of Minnesota.

Name: David H. Schiller
Title: Managing Director and Chief Investor Relations Officer
Bio: Dave joined Summit in 2016. As Chief Investor Relations Officer, he manages the firm’s business development efforts and relationships with its Limited Partners. Prior to Summit, Dave was a Managing Director with Renaissance Institutional Management, where he was responsible for business development and investor relations for hedge fund products. Previously, Dave was a Managing Director at BlackRock, where he co-led North American Institutional distribution for BlackRock Alternative Investors, the business unit responsible for BlackRock’s alternative investments in hedge funds, hedge fund of funds, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and specialized alternative products. He has also held business development and institutional relationship management roles with Barclays Global Investors and Goldman Sachs & Co. Dave holds a BA from Ohio Wesleyan University and an MBA from Babson College.

Name: Chandler Scott
Title: Vice President
Bio: Chandler focuses primarily on the technology sector. His investment experience includes DocuSketch, Fundraise Up, Jungle Scout and PriceLabs. Prior to Summit, Chandler was an Analyst at EPIC Ventures, where he focused on the technology sector and managed Junior Analyst teams in sourcing and diligence. He holds a BS in economics from Brigham Young University.

Name: Papa Yaw Sencherey
Title: Associate
Bio: Papa Yaw focuses primarily on the technology sector. Prior to Summit, Papa Yaw worked in the mergers and acquisitions group at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. He holds a BS in Business with concentrations in Finance and Entrepreneurship from the Stern School of Business at New York University.

Name: Liam Shanahan
Title: Associate
Bio: Liam focuses primarily on the technology sector. He holds a BA in economics from Harvard University and an MBA from Louisiana State University. Liam was a varsity football player at Harvard, as well as at Louisiana State University, where he served as a team captain. He continued to play professional football in the NFL before joining Summit.

Name: Mark Shankar, M.D.
Title: Vice President
Bio: Mark focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector. His investment and board experience includes LumaBridge. Prior to Summit, Mark worked on the Healthcare Investment Banking Team at Goldman Sachs. In addition, he served as a clinical assistant professor of emergency medicine at the Columbia University Vagelos College of Physician & Surgeons and was the Chief Emergency Medicine Resident at New York Presbyterian Hospital. Mark holds a BA from the University of California, Berkeley, an MD from the George Washington University School of Medicine, and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Name: Han Sikkens
Title: Managing Director and Head of Europe
Bio: Han joined Summit Partners in 2004 and today manages the firm’s London office. He focuses primarily on investments in the technology sector in Europe. Han is currently a board director at Cenosco, MUBI, Odoo, Optimove and Syncron, and he is active in the firm's investments in Akeneo, LearnUpon, Red Points and Solactive. His previous board and investment experience includes 360T Group (acquired by Deutsche Börse), Acturis Limited (acquired by Astorg), Avast (LON: AVST), Immersive Labs, Darktrace (IPO, later acquired by Thoma Bravo), Flow Traders (Euronext: FLOW), Multifonds (acquired by Temenos), RELEX Solutions (acquired by Blackstone Growth and TCV), SafeBoot (acquired by McAfee), Siteimprove (acquired by Nordic Capital) and Welltec International (acquired by Exor and 7 Industries). Prior to Summit, Han worked for Scotia Capital and IBM Corporation. He holds a BS in business administration from the University of Groningen, an MSc in international business from the University of Groningen, and an MSc in international finance from the CERAM Graduate School of Management & Technology. Han is a Dutch national and speaks Dutch and English.

Name: Ashley Conti Smith
Title: Principal
Bio: Ashley joined Summit Partners in 2019 and currently focuses on managing the firm's credit positions. Prior to Summit, Ashley worked at DDJ Capital Management where she analyzed public and private investment opportunities across the capital structure. Previously, she worked at Pro Mujer, a nonprofit organization that provides financial inclusion, health and education programs to low-income women in Latin America. Ashley began her career at Jefferies & Company and Moelis & Company in their Restructuring & Recapitalization groups. Ashley holds an AB in economics and Spanish from Bowdoin College where she was a Sarah and James Bowdoin Scholar and an MBA from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth College where she was named an Edward Tuck Scholar and received the Julia Stell Award for leadership. She currently serves on the Massachusetts General Hospital for Children (MGHfC) Family Advisory Council, a committee that aims to improve health care delivery for the pediatric community at MGHfC. Ashley is also a member of the CareWays Collaborative Board of Directors, a nonprofit focused on improving surgical and medical outcomes for pediatric patients in under-resourced countries around the world.

Name: Ross D. Stern
Title: Managing Director
Bio: Ross joined Summit Partners in 2009 and focuses primarily on the healthcare & life sciences sector.
